description: From Middle English gredyly, gredily, from Old English grǣdiglīce, grǣdelīce; equivalent to greedy +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: greedily (comparative more greedily, superlative most greedily)

entries.meaning: In a greedy manner; with keen or ardent desire.
examples: The two dogs greedily devoured the meat.
I gazed greedily on the gems in the shop window.
